edu.vserver.exercises.helpers
Class ExerTypeVoidImplCollection.RealSimpleExerciseExecutor

java.lang.Object
  VerticalLayout
      edu.vserver.exercises.helpers.ExerTypeVoidImplCollection.RealSimpleExerciseExecutor
All Implemented Interfaces:
Executor<ExerTypeVoidImplCollection.VoidExerciseData,ExerTypeVoidImplCollection.VoidSubmissionData>, java.io.Serializable
Enclosing class:
ExerTypeVoidImplCollection
public abstract static class ExerTypeVoidImplCollection.RealSimpleExerciseExecutor
extends VerticalLayout
implements Executor<ExerTypeVoidImplCollection.VoidExerciseData,ExerTypeVoidImplCollection.VoidSubmissionData>

An abstract class that can be extended to get a very simple Executor-implementor that does not care about ExerciseData-object it receives. Only usable for starting a new exercise-type-development by first developing the Executor with some fixed test-data-set.

Author:
Riku Haavisto

askSubmit

public void askSubmit(SubmissionType askedSubmType)
Description copied from interface: Executor

Asks the executor to submit a SubmissionFeedback-object from the current state of the execution and inform listeners registered through Executor.registerSubmitListener(SubmissionListener). Succeeds (at least after some delay) if the executor is in suitable ExecutionState.

SubmissionType given as a parameter must be passed to the SubmissionFeedback-object used as such as the external system uses that info to know how to handle each submissions (are they for example only saving the current state of the exercise or are they real submissions for which to show feedback etc.). It should also be noted that no error messages etc. should be shown to the user in case of a back-ground submission (#isBackgroundSubmission()) that fails because of the state of the executor.

Specified by:
askSubmit in interface Executor<ExerTypeVoidImplCollection.VoidExerciseData,ExerTypeVoidImplCollection.VoidSubmissionData>
Parameters:
askedSubmType - What kind of submissions should be done

registerSubmitListener

public void registerSubmitListener(SubmissionListener<ExerTypeVoidImplCollection.VoidSubmissionData> submitListener)

shutdown

public void shutdown()
Description copied from interface: Executor

Informs the Executor that it will be shut-down and it should perform any clean-up it might need.

This method might be called more than once. Calls after clen-up is done must be ignored.

Specified by:
shutdown in interface Executor<ExerTypeVoidImplCollection.VoidExerciseData,ExerTypeVoidImplCollection.VoidSubmissionData>
